question: Ava has a flower bed that is 211 feet long. Ava wants to fill her flower bed with plants. Ava's flowers grow 3 inches wide so she needs to leave 15.5 feet between every plant. Ava already owns 11 flowers. Each flowering plant costs $5 at the store, how much money will Ava spend at the store to fill up her flower bed?
answer:
Ava's flower bed is 211 feet / 15.5 feet per plant = <<211/15.5=13>>13 plants needed.
Ava needs to buy 13 plants - 11 plants = <<13-11=2>>2 plants needed to purchase.
Ava will spend 2 plants * $5 = $<<2*5=13>>13.
#### 13
